intro: Eriophyllum ambiguum, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, bright orange or red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Eriophyllum ambiguum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
